Package org.academics.utility

Class Utils

java.lang.Object
org.academics.utility.Utils
public class Utils extends Object
This class is used to provide utility functions.

  • Method Details

    • generateOTP

      public static int generateOTP()
      Generates a one-time password (OTP) that is a 6-digit integer between 100000 and 999999.
      Returns:
      The generated OTP.

    • getUserChoice

      public static int getUserChoice(int maxChoice)
      Prompts the user to enter a valid integer choice between 1 and maxChoice (inclusive).
      Parameters:
      maxChoice - The maximum valid choice.
      Returns:
      The user's valid integer choice.

    • getInput

      public static String getInput(String message)
      Prompts the user to enter a non-empty string input and returns it.
      Parameters:
      message - the prompt message to display to the user
      Returns:
      the non-empty string input entered by the user

    • getCurrentSession

      public static String getCurrentSession() throws SQLException
      Returns the current academic session, based on the current date.
      Returns:
      the current academic session in the format "YYYY-SEM", or null if no session is found.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs while accessing the database

    • validateEventTime

      public static boolean validateEventTime(String eventType, String session) throws SQLException
      Validates if the current date falls within the start and end date of an event of a given event type and session.
      Parameters:
      eventType - the type of the event to validate
      session - the academic session in which the event is taking place
      Returns:
      true if the current date is within the event start and end date, false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs while accessing the database

    • exportTxt

      public static void exportTxt(ResultSet resultSet, String fileName, String message)
      Exports the result set to a text file with the given filename and a custom message. The text file will contain a table with the columns "Course Code", "Course Name", "Semester", and "Grade". The file will be downloaded to the default Downloads folder of the current user on the operating system. If the operating system is not recognized, the user will be prompted to enter the path to download the file.
      Parameters:
      resultSet - the result set to be exported
      fileName - the name of the file to be downloaded
      message - the message to be included in the file

    • exportCSV

      public static void exportCSV(ResultSet resultSet, String fileName, String[] p_extraColumnHeaders)
      Exports the contents of a ResultSet object to a CSV file.
      Parameters:
      resultSet - the ResultSet object to be exported
      fileName - the name of the CSV file to be created
      p_extraColumnHeaders - an array of additional column headers to include in the CSV file

    • printTable

      public static void printTable(ResultSet resultSet, String[] columnNames, String successMessage, String failureMessage) throws SQLException
      Prints a table of results fetched from a ResultSet object.
      Parameters:
      resultSet - the ResultSet object containing the results to print
      columnNames - an array of column names to be used as table headers
      successMessage - the message to print if the results are successfully fetched
      failureMessage - the message to print if the ResultSet object is empty
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
